question.body: The partial negative charge at one end of a water molecule is attracted to the partial positive charge of another water molecule. This attraction is called:

response.feedback: Incorrect. A covalent bond is the sharing of electrons.
Incorrect. A hydration shell is formed when water surrounds an ion.
Correct. A hydrogen bond occurs when the partial positive end of one water molecule is attracted to the partial negative end of a neighboring water molecule.
Incorrect. A hydrophobic bond occurs because of it being excluded from water, not bonding with water.
Incorrect. Ionic bonding occurs after atoms gain or lose electrons. This does not occur between water molecules.
